trans-unit.source: Provides the mobile text writer adapter class for the WML device adapter set specifically designed for Openwave's UP browser.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.UpWmlMobileTextWriter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET, and must have a default constructor.
The base writer object.
An object of the <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities"></xref> class that provides the capability information for the specific device.
A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage"></xref> object.
Analyzes a single postback.
Called internally by the writer and inherited classes.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to include in the post fields the information for all <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler"></xref> interfaces in the form; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to include no <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler"></xref> information.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType"></xref>.
Begins a custom markup section.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Begins the given form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The form to begin.
Returns the calculated URL required to post the form to the server.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the current form submits to an external URL; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to encode the URL string; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The calculated URL required to post the form to the server.
Returns the query string to add to the URL to post the form to the server.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The query string.
Ends the current form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Analyzes a form after it is completed during the analyze phase.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Begins rendering a hyperlink element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This call can be followed by calls to render text or by a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.UpWmlMobileTextWriter.RenderImage%2A> method to render the hyperlink contents, followed by a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.UpWmlMobileTextWriter.RenderEndHyperlink%2A> method.
The URL target.
Set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the URL is encoded.
The softkey text to use for the link if the `mapToSoftkey` parameter is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.

Set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the softkey label comes from the adapter itself (the default label, or something else that is adapter-specified, such as "Call" for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall"></xref> control), rather than being a softkey label explicitly specified by the application author.
Set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if mapping to a softkey on the device.
the writer has already begun to write a hyperlink, -or- the response is a postback.
Begins the rendering of a postback.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The softkey text to use for the link if the `mapToSoftkey` parameter is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.

Set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the softkey label comes from the adapter itself (the default label, or something else that is adapter-specified, such as "Call" for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PhoneCall"></xref> control), rather than being a softkey label explicitly specified by the application author.
Set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if mapping to a softkey on the device.
the writer has begun to write a hyperlink, -or- the response is a postback.
Begins the rendering of a selection list.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The name of the control.
The name that the browser must use to submit the selected index back to the server.
The initial value.
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_Title" name="Title" href=""></xref> attribute on WML devices.
Whether to allow multiple selections.
Completes the rendering of a form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Renders a closing hyperlink tag to the response stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Contains <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a line break should follow the control.
Contains <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> otherwise.
the writer is not writing a hyperlink.
Completes the rendering of a postback.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Contains the target URL of the postback.
Contains the argument associated with the target URL.
Specifies the type of postback.
Must be a value from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType"></xref> enumeration.
Contains a Boolean value indicating whether postback variables should be calculated.
Contains <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a line break should follow the control.
Contains <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> otherwise.
the writer has not begun writing a postback.
Completes the rendering of a selection list.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Indicates whether a break must follow the selection list.
Renders any <xref uid="langword_csharp_i-mode" name="i-mode" href=""></xref> or <xref uid="langword_csharp_J-Phone" name="J-Phone" href=""></xref> image references.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Specifies the image URL.
Specifies an optional local image name.
Specifies text to display if the image cannot be displayed.
Set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a break is required after the image.
Renders a single option within a selection list.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The option text.
Renders a single option within a selection list.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The option text.
(Optional.) The option value.
Renders a text element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text string to be rendered.
Specifies whether a break must follow the element.
Specifies whether the text must be encoded.
Renders a text box element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Identifies the control.
Specifies the initial value of the text box.
Specifies an optional WML format string.
Contains the title of the text box.
Specifies the password.
Sets the size of the string.
Specifies the maximum length of the string.
Determines whether the identifier for the control (ID) is encrypted.
Set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a break is required after the control is rendered.
